description: From Middle English notifien, a borrowing from Old French notifier, notefiier.

verbs.description: notify (third-person singular simple present notifies, present participle notifying, simple past and past participle notified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give (someone) notice (of some event). [from mid-15th c.]
examples: The dispatcher immediately notified the volunteer fire department of the emergency call.
Once a decision has been reached and notified to the parties it becomes binding.
